name: Clayton Ettienne

topics.response_text: Hi there. Welcome to the Westside Co-op. I'm Clayton Ettienne. Let me know if you have any questions.
It might not look like much, but it's what keeps us Westside locals independent.

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.
I'm here to talk to you about our new "business" arrangement.
topics.response_text: Oh... that. Yes. Anderson filled me in on the details. Just let me know when you'd like your... order to be filled.
{sighing}Yes, it just came in. Here's all of it.
Well, I've lived in Nevada all my life. Started out in New Reno, but headed down here as soon as I got the chance.

topics.topic_text: I know how the Westside farmers have been getting their water.
topics.response_text: Uh... okay, look... first, I didn't have anything to do with that trooper. That was all Anderson.

topics.topic_text: Whose idea was it to use the kid?
topics.response_text: It was Hector's idea, if you can believe it. He overheard me talking to Anderson about his idea to divert the water over here.

topics.topic_text: What went down with Anderson and Corporal White?
topics.response_text: Pretty much what you'd expect. White talked to Hector and then went to talk to Anderson.
Wait... what are you going to do?

topics.topic_text: I'm going to have a chat with Anderson. Don't worry.
topics.response_text: You're the one who should be worried. Good luck.
Please, just... don't let them shut down the co-op.

topics.topic_text: Hope you're not too attached to this place.

description:
Clayton Ettienne is a 45 year-old Hispanic Male.

Clayton Ettienne is the co-owner and manager of the Westside Cooperative, a self-sufficient community in the Mojave Wasteland. A pragmatic and resourceful leader, he has transformed Westside from a struggling settlement into a thriving agricultural community with a stable trade surplus.

Clayton Ettienne's Personality: Pragmatic, community-oriented, and fiercely independent. Clayton is a natural leader who values self-reliance and has a no-nonsense approach to problem-solving. He is protective of Westside's autonomy and wary of external influence, particularly from the NCR.

Clayton Ettienne's Backstory: Born in the raider-controlled city of New Reno, Clayton witnessed firsthand the brutal power struggles between the Mordinos, Wrights, and later the Van Graffs. Disgusted by the constant violence and corruption, he decided to seek a better life elsewhere and migrated east to the Mojave Wasteland. After wandering for years, he settled in Westside, a struggling community on the outskirts of New Vegas. Recognizing the potential for sustainable agriculture, he partnered with Tom Anderson from the Followers of the the Apocalypse to develop a decentralized farming model. Their efforts were successful, establishing Westside's food independence and eventually creating a trade surplus that allowed the community to remain independent from NCR control.
